Articles.Content: un nerf the proton!!

adding animTime = 1 to the config with animSwitch = false should do the job.

Assemble what craft ?

Soyuz, want to know what part to put where.

Soyuz, want to know what part to put where.

Check mod archive, it should contain craft files with assembled vehicles.

Look at the "Stock" craft that come with the mod (If you don't have these in sandbox, put the Ships folder that came in the mod in the main KSP directory, not under gamedata.), and play around with them in the editor. You should be able to take them apart piece by piece and figure out everything from there.

As for Soyuz, IIRC it goes:

LES

Dock Port

Orbital Module

Descent Pod

Heatshield

Decoupler (Or TMA decoupler, depending on the Soyuz variant.)

Service Module (Panels go on side.)

Fairing Base. (For the Soyuz U, launching a TMA or standard Soyuz, you have to put on the extender fairing parts for it to fit properly.)

Soyuz Stage three

Stage 2/3 Decoupler

Etc.

Look at the "Stock" craft that come with the mod (If you don't have these in sandbox, put the Ships folder that came in the mod in the main KSP directory, not under gamedata.), and play around with them in the editor. Hi guys, (im running 0.23)

not sure if its my KSP problem or the Mod bug.

Im using Soviet pack & my Kerbals will vanish n die upon EVA in space. But when i EVA before launch its okay

Any solutions? search around but couldn't find any solutions

Thanks!

Probably something to do with the life support, there is air on Kerbin so if you EVA before launch it's fine. Check that you have everything installed correctly.

Do they die instantly on EVA, or some time after you get out of the ship?
I had this problem if you delete the life support folder it will stop otherwise you will inherit life support on everything
Seems to me like the LOK is more primitive than the soyuz.

Seems to me like the LOK is more primitive than the soyuz.

Yes, it is, at least if you're talking this pack. The Soyuz in this pack is the latest TMA version, while LOK is a derivative of Soyuz 7K. TMA is the 3rd generation, while LOK is 1st generation.
Has the Soyuz update been released yet or have I missed it?
Nope, BobCat is probably waiting for ECLSS 2.0. I understand him, a lot of my stuff is on hold until that's out, too.
